subject: HISTORY
text: Place the following events in the century appropriate to each on the accompanying table:—The guardianship of Wallace ; the death of Charlemagne ; the battle of Inkerman ; the reign of Henry V. of England : the execution of Charles I.; the capture of William the Lion ; the death of Napoleon I.; the murder of Harnley ; the reign of Harold of England; the battle of Plassey ; the reign of Canute ; the career of the Black Prince ; the massacre of St. Bartholomew; the union of the Piets and Scots; the battle of Culloden ; the Franco-Prussian War.

subject: HISTORY
text: Who was King of Scots at the date of the Norman Conquest of England ?

subject: HISTORY
question: 2. b
text: Which King of England had David II. of Scotland as a prisoner ?

subject: HISTORY
question: 2. c
text: What marriage is described as “the Union of the Thistle and the Rose” ?

subject: HISTORY
question: 2. d
text: Which King of England and Scotland obtained Bombay as his wife’s dowry ?

subject: HISTORY
question: 2. e
text: Which King of France helped the American Colonists against Great Britain ?

subject: HISTORY
question: 2. f
text: Who was President of the United States of America at the time of the American Civil War (1861-1865) ?

subject: HISTORY
text: What part was played in Scottish history by any three of the following :— Queen Margaret (Avife of Malcolm Caumore) ; Alex¬ ander TIL ; the first Regent Albany ; James IV.; the Marquis of Montrose ?

subject: HISTORY
text: Give some account of three sieges which Edinburgh Castle sustained.

subject: HISTORY
text: Relate briefly the events which led up to the coronation of Robert Bruce, the battle of Sauchieburn, the battle of Langside.

subject: HISTORY
text: Give a short account of any two of the following :— the career of John Knox ; the administration of Lauderdale ; the Darien Scheme ; the Jacobite Rebellion of (1715).

subject: HISTORY
text: What historical events and historical characters are depicted by Scott in any one of the following poems or novels :— The Lord of the Isles; The Abbot; Old Mortality Waverley ? Give a brief account of what you have read in Scott on the subject selected.

subject: HISTORY
text: What part was played by the following Scotsmen in the reign of George III. :—Lord Bute; Admiral Dun¬ can (Lord Camperdown); Sir John Moore ; Henry Dundas. (Lord Melville) ?

subject: HISTORY
text: Give some account of any two of the following :— King David ; Themistocles ; Agricola-; Saladin ; the Emperor Charles V. ; Cardinal Richelieu ; Lord Clarendon; the Empress Maria Theresa Louis Philippe, King of the French; Garibaldi.

subject: HISTORY
text: What were the causes of the invasion of France by Edward III., and of the expulsion of the English from France in the reign of Henry VI. ?

subject: HISTORY
text: What events in the history of England ar« connected with any three of the following Nectansmere, Carham, Sluys, Cadiz, New Plymouth, 'Tangier?

subject: HISTORY
text: “ Bosworth Field marks the end of the power of the English barons.” How far is this statement supported bv the history of the reigns of Henry VII. and Henry VIII. ?

subject: HISTORY
text: What misdeeds and mistakes on the part of James II. in England brought about the Revolution of 1688-89?

subject: HISTORY
text: Write notes on any three of the following:— The Gunpowder Plot; the career of the Duke of Buckingham ; the New Model Army ; the battle of Blenheim ; the South Sea Bubble; the capture of Quebec.

subject: HISTORY
text: Trace the growth of the Australasian Colonies.

subject: HISTORY
text: What alliances did Great Britain make with Russia and Austria in the great French War? Which of the two Powers was the more faithful ally ?

subject: HISTORY
text: Whom do you consider the greatest figure in Queen Victoria’s reign ? Give your reasons.
